description: This chapter discusses lawsuits among believers, the sanctity of the body, and warnings against sexual immorality.

questions.question: Where should believers not take their disputes?
Where should believers take their disputes?
Who will the Lord's people judge?
If the Lord's people will judge the world, what should they be competent to judge?
Who else will believers judge?
What should believers be able to judge?
Who should be appointed to judge disputes about the things of this life?
options: Those whose way of life is scorned in the church

questions.question: Why did Paul say this to the Corinthians?
options: I say this to shame you

questions.question: What is needed to judge disputes between believers?
options: Is it possible that there is nobody among you wise enough

questions.question: Before whom does one brother take another to court?
options: And this in front of unbelievers

questions.question: What does it mean that believers have lawsuits among them?
options: The very fact that you have lawsuits among you means you have been completely defeated already

questions.question: Instead of filing lawsuits, what should believers do?
options: Why not rather be wronged? Why not rather be cheated?

questions.question: What were the Corinthians doing?
options: Instead, you yourselves cheat and do wrong

questions.question: What will wrongdoers not inherit?
Which sins does Paul list as preventing people from inheriting the kingdom of God?
options: Neither the sexually immoral nor idolaters nor adulterers nor men who have sex with men nor thieves nor the greedy nor drunkards nor slanderers nor swindlers

questions.question: What were some of the Corinthians previously?
options: And that is what some of you were

questions.question: What happened to the believers?
options: But you were washed, you were sanctified, you were justified

questions.question: How were believers washed, sanctified, and justified?
options: In the name of the Lord Jesus Christ and by the Spirit of our God

questions.question: What does Paul claim to have the right to do?
options: I have the right to do anything

questions.question: Even though Paul has the right to do anything, what is not everything?
What does Paul say he will not be?
options: But I will not be mastered by anything

questions.question: What is the relationship between the stomach and food?
options: Food for the stomach and the stomach for food
Food is harmful to the stomach
Food is good for the stomach

questions.question: What will God do to the stomach and food?
options: And God will destroy them both

questions.question: What is the body meant for?
options: The body, however, is not meant for sexual immorality but for the Lord, and the Lord for the body

questions.question: How did God raise the Lord?
options: By his power God raised the Lord from the dead

questions.question: How will God raise us?
options: And he will raise us also

questions.question: Whose members are believers' bodies?
options: Do you not know that your bodies are members of Christ himself

questions.question: How should the members of Christ not be used?
options: Shall I then take the members of Christ and unite them with a prostitute?

questions.question: What happens to one who unites with a prostitute?
options: Do you not know that he who unites himself with a prostitute is one with her in body?

questions.question: What is said about one who unites with a prostitute?
options: The two will live and die
For it is said, 'The two will become one flesh'

questions.question: What happens to one who is united with the Lord?
options: But whoever is united with the Lord is one with him in spirit
Is one with him in body
Is one with him in mind
Is one with him in heart

questions.question: What should believers do regarding sexual immorality?
Where are all other sins a person commits?
options: All other sins a person commits are outside the body

questions.question: Against what does a person who sins sexually sin?
options: But whoever sins sexually, sins against their own body

questions.question: What are believers' bodies?
options: Do you not know that your bodies are temples of the Holy Spirit

questions.question: How did believers receive the Holy Spirit?
options: Who is in you, whom you have received from God

questions.question: To whom do believers belong?
How were believers acquired?
options: You were bought at a price

questions.question: How should believers honor God?
options: Therefore honor God with your bodies

questions.question: What is Paul's final instruction to believers in this chapter?
options: Therefore honor God with your bodies
